sub_topic: Riemann mapping theorem and its applications
message_1: What is the conformal map of the unit disk onto the upper half plane and what is its inverse?
message_2:
The conformal map of the unit disk onto the upper half plane is given by the MÃ¶bius transformation:

f(z) = (i(z + 1))/(z - 1)

where z is a complex number in the unit disk, and i is the imaginary unit.

The inverse of this conformal map, which maps the upper half plane back to the unit disk, is given by:

f^(-1)(w) = (w - i)/(w + i)

where w is a complex number in the upper half plane.
